@graph.caption: two bowls with peanut noodles with a hand holding a fork with some noodles

@graph.name: Peanut Noodles - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: If you're looking for an easy comfort food meal for dinner, then try these peanut noodles. The recipe is super easy to make and completely vegan!

@graph.name: Peanut Noodles
@graph.description: If you're looking for an easy comfort food meal for dinner, then try these peanut noodles. The recipe is super easy to make, packed with flavor, and completely vegan!

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the rice noodles according to the instructions on the package. Set aside. Place all ingredients in a blender.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the rice noodles according to the instructions on the package. Set aside. Place all ingredients in a blender.

recipeInstructions.text: Process until smooth. / (If you're using a Thermomix like I did choose: 3 min/ speed 3/70°C).
recipeInstructions.name: Process until smooth. / (If you're using a Thermomix like I did choose: 3 min/ speed 3/70°C).

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to a small bowl and set aside for later.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to a small bowl and set aside for later.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the garlic and the ginger and cut the green onions into rings. Then heat the sesame oil in a large pan and cook it for 3 minutes on high heat. Stir constantly. / (If you're using a Thermomix choose: 5 sec/speed 8 and then 3 min/120 °C/wooden spoon (soft stir) without measuring lid).
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the garlic and the ginger and cut the green onions into rings. Then heat the sesame oil in a large pan and cook it for 3 minutes on high heat. Stir constantly. / (If you're using a Thermomix choose: 5 sec/speed 8 and then 3 min/120 °C/wooden spoon (soft stir) without measuring lid).

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the red bell pepper into thin strips, the broccoli into small florets, the zucchini into half moons, and the carrots into thin slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the red bell pepper into thin strips, the broccoli into small florets, the zucchini into half moons, and the carrots into thin slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the vegetables and 2/3 of the peanut sauce to the green onion, ginger, and garlic mixture in the pan. Cook for 5 minutes on high heat. Stir constantly. / (If you're using a Thermomix choose: 5 min/120 °C/ speed 1).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the vegetables and 2/3 of the peanut sauce to the green onion, ginger, and garlic mixture in the pan. Cook for 5 minutes on high heat. Stir constantly. / (If you're using a Thermomix choose: 5 min/120 °C/ speed 1).

recipeInstructions.text: Place into a large bowl and add the cooked rice noodles and the remaining peanut sauce. Toss until well combined. If you want you could add some green onion rings and red pepper flakes on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into a large bowl and add the cooked rice noodles and the remaining peanut sauce. Toss until well combined. If you want you could add some green onion rings and red pepper flakes on top.
